prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Carroll County (Va.) Register of Births, 1892. Local government records collection, Carroll County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia as a gift from Bernice Franke under the Accession number 51429.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Carroll County was named for Charles Carroll of Carrollton, a signer of the Declaration of Independence from Maryland. It was formed from Grayson County in 1842, and part of Patrick County was added later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Carroll County (Va.) Register of Births, 1892. This item consists of register of births from the Fancy Gap District which includes the date, name of child, place of birth, father's name in full if the child was born in wedlock, father's occupation, father's residence, mother's name in full, the number of children, name of person giving the information of birth and the relation of informant to person born, whether of kindred and its degree, head of a family, friend, neighbor, or midwife.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Carroll County Marriage Records and Vital Statistics may be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm
